column4: yesterday i updated to breezy and now i can't use ndiswrapper anymore. i installed the kernel headers, but it compiling the module still fails
why are you compileing the drivers
there in the repos
the ndiswrapper package simply puts a src tar.bz2 in /usr/src/
and it is quite outdated
the one I have works fine and it's 1.2
oh
and it actualy gave me the drivers
which repo do i have to add then?
universe i believe
also there is a neat little gtk app do a serch for ndis in synaptic is't awsome
no need for the console open the app and it asks where the inf file is and once done you hit install and it works
i have added universe, and there is no ndiswrapper binary module
one sec
the thing you want is called ndiswrapper-utils
just do sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper-utils
that should be all you need
if you want a gui add ndisgtk after it
so sudo ndiswrapper-utils ndisgtk
you find it
the ubuntu doc in the wiki would have told you about ndiswrapper-utils
don't make things harder than they need to be :-)
